FuncDef: This command enables triggering packet to initiate RADIUS authentication that provides a service context. The authentication, together with the service context for this request, creates a managed SAP. The VLAN is the same as the triggering packet. This SAP behaves as a regular SAP but the configuration is not user-editable and not maintained in the configuration file. The managed SAP remains active as long as the session is active.
CLIs: trigger-packet [ dhcp ] [ pppoe ] [ arp ] [ dhcp6 ] [ ppp ] [ rtr-solicit ] [ data ]

ParaDef.Info: Specifies whether the receipt of DHCP trigger packets on this VPLS SAP when the keyword capture-sap is specified in the sap command creation string, will result in a RADIUS authentication that will provide a service context and the creation of a SAP with a value of managed.

Specifies whether the receipt of PPPoE trigger packets on this VPLS SAP when the keyword capture-sap is specified in the sap command creation string, will result in a RADIUS authentication that will provide a service context and the creation of a SAP with a value of managed.
Indicates that ARP is the type of trigger packets for this entry.
Indicates that DHCP6 is the type of trigger packets for this entry.
Indicates that PPP is the type of trigger packets for this entry.
Indicates that router solicit is the type of trigger packets for this entry.
Indicates that data is the type of trigger packets for this entry.
